complianceData.opengovNotes: Property tax assessment (CAMA) is not an OpenGov product. Would require partnership or integration.
laws: California Revenue and Taxation Code Division 1
regulations: State Board of Equalization Property Tax Rules
requirements: 2% annual assessment increase cap unless property sold
Assessment at fair market value as of January 1
Special assessment districts require 2/3 voter approval
complianceData.notes: CA has unique Prop 13 limitations making property tax systems highly specialized

complianceData.opengovNotes: Property tax assessment (CAMA) is not an OpenGov product. Would require partnership or integration.
regulations: Texas Comptroller Property Tax Assistance Division rules
requirements: Market value assessment as of January 1
complianceData.notes: TX requires annual reappraisal unlike CA - different system architecture needed

complianceData.opengovNotes: Property tax assessment (CAMA) is not an OpenGov product. Would require partnership or integration.
regulations: Florida Department of Revenue Property Tax Oversight
requirements: Save Our Homes: 3% cap on homesteaded property increases
Portability of SOH benefit when moving
Tangible personal property tax for businesses
Assessment ratio: 100% for all property classes
complianceData.notes: FL Save Our Homes creates complex portability calculations

complianceData.opengovNotes: OpenGov does not offer full payroll processing. Integration with ADP, Paychex, or other payroll providers required.
requirements: State Disability Insurance (SDI): 1.1% on wages up to $153,164
Paid Family Leave (PFL) funded through SDI
Wage statements must include: hours worked, piece rates, deductions, net wages, pay period dates
Semi-monthly pay frequency required for most employees
complianceData.notes: CA has most complex payroll compliance in US - mandatory itemized wage statements

complianceData.opengovNotes: OpenGov does not offer time & attendance. Integration with time clock systems required.
requirements: Meal breaks: 30 minutes unpaid for 5+ hour shifts (2nd break for 10+ hours)
Rest breaks: 10 minutes paid per 4 hours worked
Overtime: 1.5x after 8 hours/day AND after 40 hours/week, 2x after 12 hours/day
7th consecutive day: 1.5x first 8 hours, 2x after 8 hours
Alternative workweek schedules allowed with 2/3 employee vote
Recordkeeping: 3 years for time records, 4 years for wage statements
Meal and rest break premium pay required for violations
complianceData.notes: CA has unique daily overtime rules unlike federal FLSA
